intro: Phacelia hughesii, commonly known as Hughes' phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Hughes' phacelia is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
